revised_title: Magnetic Domain Configurations in Iron-Silicon Alloy Single-Crystal Plates: X-ray Topographic Observations and Interpretation
tldr: The authors study the magnetic domain configurations in single-crystal plates of iron-silicon alloy using X-ray topography. They develop a model using a regular octahedron to represent the possible magnetization states and derive rules for domain shapes and volumes. The findings help in understanding the hierarchy of domains in (112)-orientation plates and provide insights into the magnetization process.
